laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal nuclear staining of MLH1 was found, but expression of MSH2 was absent. Staining for MSH6 was indeterminate.

A heterozygous disease-causing mutation in the MSH2 gene was detected; specifically, an insertion mutation 34_35insG was found that resulted in a premature stop at codon 80 in exon 2 of the MSH2 gene.
Completely normal findings with no evidence of polyps or malignancy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeated colonoscopy 2 years later revealed a single polyp with normal mucosal histology and without evidence of microsatellite instability (MSI).
Repeated 6 months later and findings remained normal.
